question: 倒壊
sourceMnemonic: When something <kanji>collapse</kanji>s and <kanji>break</kanji>s, it is when a <vocabulary>collapse</vocabulary> happens. When this happens, it is <vocabulary>destruction</vocabulary>. It is also probably something that was already <vocabulary>crumbling</vocabulary> apart.
sourceReadingMnemonic: This is a jukugo word, which usually means on'yomi readings from the kanji. If you know the readings of your kanji you'll know how to read this as well.
